item.title: A Username/Password database
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

I'm making a database for your Usernames/Passwords with Python atm. The first version will have Add/remove/Save and load functions, for Usernames and Passwords only. I will be adding more in the future but if anyone would like to look at my code so far.. here it is.

# Not Finished Procedure-
def print_usernames(username):
    print "Usernames:"
def add_usernames(usernames):
    usernames[password] = username
def remove_usernames(usernames,password):
    if usernames.has_key(password):
        del username[password]
    else:
        print username,"was not found"
def save_usernames(usernames,filename):
    out_file = open(filename,"w")
    for x in usernames.keys():
        our_file.write(x+","+usernames[x]+"\n")
    our_file.close()
def print_menu():
    print '1. Add a username/password'
    print '2. Remove a username/password'
    print '3. List usernames/passwords'
    print '4. Quit'
User_list = ()
menu_choice = 0
print_menu()
while menu_choice !=7:
    menu_choice = input("Type in a number for selection (1-4):")
    if menu_choice == 1:
        print "Add username and password"
        usernames = raw_input("Username:")
        password = raw_input ("Password:")
        add_username(username_list,usernames,password)
    elif menu_choice == 2:
        print "Remove username/password"
        usernames = raw_input ("Username:")
        remove_number(username_list, usernames)

If there is anything wrong or that I could do differently, Just post about it.. Thanks
